summary:
"If he doesn't come back," Jon Snow promised, "Ghost and I will find him." he put his hand on the direworf's head.
"I believe...
body:
“If he doesn’t come back,” Jon Snow promised, “Ghost and I will find him.” he put his hand on the direworf’s head.

“I believe you,” Tyrion said, but what he thought was, And who will find you? He shivered.

~Game of Thrones, George R. R. Martin

summary: As requested by @disneyprincessbuffyannesummers[[MORE]]     Y/n hated it there; she longed to be free and away from the clutches...
body:
As requested by @disneyprincessbuffyannesummers






Y/n hated it there; she longed to be free and away from the clutches of her leering father. Some nights she dreamt that she was someone else; instead of being unhappy of her existence Y/n was happy. Her father had preyed upon her since she was young, making Y/n and her sisters his bride, no one was allowed to touch them or look upon them. The hope she once held about escaping and leaving everything behind begun to diminish when she learned that she was with child. She did not wish to endanger her unborn child out there in the wilderness on her own; Y/n preyed that her father would not take her child away from her and sacrifices them to the white walkers.  

Y/n was seven moons when the Lord Commander and his rangers arrived to meet with her father; she had wandered outside to gather some water from the well. Her sisters had asked her to be careful, worried of the harm it may cause to her child, but her father did not care and ordered her outside anyway. She had been struggling with a heavy bucket of water when a young man came to her aid, at first she was weary she had never had been treated with kindness.

‘Let me help you with that’ he offered as saw her swollen stomach.

‘No I can manage’

‘It looks heavy; please I just want to help’

Y/n looked into his eyes attempting to see if he was lying but instead she saw only kindness, no coldness behind them. Jon takes the bucket from her hand as they slowly walk back towards her fathers keep.

‘Thank you’ she tells him ‘I am sorry if I was rude, my sisters and I are strangers to such kindnesses

‘I’m Jon’

‘Y/n’

‘Is your father always so…forward?’

‘My father is a monster’ she tells him with a scowl ‘I wish I could get away from here’

‘Did he do that to you?’

Y/n looks down at her stomach as she cradles herself with her hands.

‘Yes’

‘I am so sorry’

‘You do not need to apologise Jon, you did not do this and you do not know the horrors of what my father is capable of’ They stop a few feet from the entrance of the wooden building, Jon looks back at her concerned that something was wrong ‘I can take the bucket now, if my father catches you talking to me he will kill you’

‘I am not afraid of him’

‘Please, I do not want your death on my conscience’

Jon places the handle back into her hands and watches her walk back inside the dark hall; the wind begins to blow harder forcing him to wrap his cloak tighter around his neck.  He stays outside a little longer as his mind wanders back to Craster’s daughter Y/n; she was beautiful and could not believe that she had to suffer at the hands of her father. He was angered that the Lord Commander had done nothing to stop the man, if that had been his own sister Jon would have Craster killed. No longer able to take the cold wind Jon walks inside and finds Craster trying to grab at Y/n, but she escapes his clutches and rushes away. Jon takes a seat by the Lord Commander as he looks into the flames of the fire, attempting to ignore Craster and his cruel words.

That night the air had become colder as the fire began to dwindle, Jon shivers as he tries his hardest to stay warm. His back is pressed against the wall as he watches the others sleep on the floor, he was having trouble sleeping as he thought about his family. His mind is pulled away when he hears light footsteps approach him, as he scans the dim hall he can see Y/n walking towards him as she tries her hardest not to wake the others. In her arms she held a large wool blanket as she holds it out to him.

‘I saw that you were cold, I thought you could use a blanket’

‘Your father…’

‘You are safe, please take it, it is also to say thank you for helping me’

‘Thank you’ he tells her with a small smile.

‘Can I sit with you a while?’

Jon nods before she slowly sits down by his side, he sees her shiver as she settles down and wraps both her and himself in the blanket. He feels his body gradually warm up thanks to the thickness of the blanket.

‘Aren’t you worried that someone might see us?’ he asks as he looks at Y/n.

‘Not at this moment, I am so tired. My babe keeps me up at night and cannot sleep; it is nice to find someone to talk to other than my sisters. What made you join the Night watch?  Don’t you miss your family?’

‘My father was leaving for King’s Landing, with my sisters Arya and Sansa. I am a bastard, their mother Lady Stark does not like my presence at Winterfell and I would no longer be welcomed’

‘I never knew my mother; she died giving birth to me. Your mother does she live?’

‘I don’t know, my father never talked about her, he was ashamed for so long. Sometimes I think he regrets me’

‘I think your father loved you, he kept you at Winterfell for some time, I do not think he regrets your birth Jon. My father, he only see’s us as cattle and does not care that we are his own children. Where is your father?’ she asks curiously as she pulls the blanket tighter against her body.

‘He was killed by the Lannister’s’

‘Why would they do that?’

‘He told the truth and he died because of it, now my brother Robb marches for war against the Lannister’s. I don’t know if Arya and Sansa are still alive, my brother Bran and Rickon are alone at Winterfell’ he tells her as tears form in his eyes.

‘You should go to them, help them’

‘I can’t I made a vow’

‘I wish I could leave, I hate it here if I stay here I will die and so will my child’

‘How can you know that will happen?’

‘My father he does something with our children, he has sacrificed my brothers to the cold dark night. He takes them while we are sleeping and takes them into the woods, that is why there is no men here, no boys’ Y/n bows her head as she avoids his gaze.

‘What does he do to them?’

‘You wouldn’t believe me, no one does. They think we are all mad’

‘Please Y/n’

Y/n raises her head and looks into his eyes.

‘White walkers, he gives them to them so that he may live, he does not care for us’

‘White walkers are myth’

‘Tonight follow my father into the woods, my sister gave birth to a child he will take him and he will not be seen again’ telling him firmly, at the same time she feels her child kick within her ‘Ouch’

‘Are you okay?’

‘My child, they kicked. Do you want to feel it?’

He doesn’t answer her and only nods, Y/n takes his hand and places it onto her stomach, and he waits for a moment as he feels a small nudge against his palm he smiles as he looks down at his hand. Jon was surprised that the child continued to kick, he then looks up to Y/n and sees her smiling brightly. He was drawn into her beauty and her smile, after everything that was happening to her and around her she had a reason to smile.

‘I will help you’

Y/n looks up and meets his stare.

‘Help me?’

‘Get away from here, from your father I can keep you and your child safe’

‘Truly? It is not a trick’

‘Everything I have seen with the Night watch, it wasn’t what I expected. My family need me, I have to get back to my brother and help him with the Lannister’s’ he tells her ‘Gather your things, I will meet you outside and we will leave’

‘Thank you Jon, thank you’ Y/n leans into him and presses her lips against his cheek; she fails to see the red tint spreading onto his cheeks ‘I will get my things’

Y/n quickly stands and sneaks away as quiet as she can, whilst Jon walks outside into the cold night and to the stables. He quickly places the saddle onto the horse and the reins, hoping that he would not be seen and stopped. He is only waiting for a short time when Y/n finally joins him in the stables with a bag across her body.

‘Are you sure we should be doing this? I have heard what they do when men leave the Night’s Watch’

‘My brother needs me, if you’re right and stay here with your father you may die. If you come with me I promise to keep you safe, I give you my word’ he vows ‘I will not hurt you’

‘Okay, I will come but I think you will need to help me up onto your horse’

Jon chuckles as he takes her hand leading her to his stead, placing his hands onto her waist he lifts her up with a groan and places her onto the saddle.  Y/n shuffles forward so that Jon can sit behind her, as Jon climbs up Y/n feels his chest against her back. He moves his arms around her and takes the reins; he slowly leads the horse out of the camp hoping that they will not be heard and picks up the pace when he know they are safely away.

Along the way Y/n and Jon become lost in fog and mist, instead of leading them towards the wall they head further north. Jon becomes worried that he may come across wildlings in the hills, both of them scared that they may be caught by the Night’s Watch or her father. But her father had no army, he could lead a search for her and take her back home but the other rangers could. As time passed it was becoming harder for Y/n to move and travel upon the horse, Jon hoped to find somewhere safe for them to stay so she could give birth to her child.

They had camped for the night along the mountains, Jon had created a smile fire to keep them warm but it was so cold it wasn’t working.  Jon had wrapped them in a fur blanket that Y/n had brought with her; he hoped that their bodies close together would keep them warm. Y/n was the first to fall asleep, her head rested on his shoulder as he heard her lightly snore and Jon followed shortly after. Jon had to admire her, not once had she complained through their journey even when they realised they were lost and had no idea where they were going, but one thing he needed to do was get to his brother before it was too late.

They woke the next morning with figures standing above them and swords pointed at them, they were wildings, Jon quickly reaches for his sword but finds it missing.

‘Looking for this?’ a woman’s voice asks him, he looks up towards the voice and watches as they pull down their hood.

‘Another raven has lost his way, we should take him to Mance, and he will know what to do with him’ another voice interrupts.

‘Maybe we could kill him; he will lead more of the Night’s watch here’

Y/n shuffles her body into his side, scared of what they might do to them, worried that they may harm her baby.

‘I am no longer with the Night’s Watch’ Jon tells them firmly.

‘Ran off with a woman I see, I don’t understand those men and their stupid vows’ the woman speaks up ‘Take them with us, Mance will want to talk to this one’

Both Y/n and Jon are grabbed from behind and quickly pulled to their feet, the movement causing Y/n pain and clutch her stomach.

‘Ouch!’ Y/n calls out.

‘What’s wrong with her?’ the woman asks as she walks towards Y/n and pulls open her cloak. She smirks when she sees the woman’s swollen belly ‘Well someone has been busy’

Y/n and Jon have their hands tied and are taken on a long trek back the wildlings camp, Y/n remains by his side and do as the Wildlings asked scared of what they may do if she does not. It takes days before they reach the camp, both Jon and Y/n are surprised of the numbers of the free folk that are there and when they see a giant. They are pushed and shoved through the crowds of people that watch their arrival until they are pushed inside a large tent. It is there they are questioned by a man called Mance Raydar who was once a man of the Night’s Watch, many think the leader is made for allowing to live and believing that they may be spies.  But Mance listens to Jon telling them his reasons for leaving everything behind, Mance even offers the pair a tent believing that Y/n and Jon are together; even carrying Jon’s child.

During the night as Y/n lies on the ground upon the furs she goes into labour, Jon leaves her alone to find someone to help and finds an old woman who had assisted on many of the births of the free folk. As he walks into the tent he finds Y/n sitting up and her face contorted in pain, he quickly sits by her side as he tries to comfort her. The old woman moves between Y/n’s legs and lifts up her skirts, exposing her legs to the cold air.

‘Please don’t leave me Jon’

‘I’m not going anywhere’

Jon is true to his word and stays by her side; he does not leave the tent, not caring if he should be there or not. It is in the early hours of the following morning that her baby makes its way into the world, Jon holds firmly onto her hand as the old woman tells her to push. Y/n does as she says and begins to push; it is after the fifth push that she feels her baby escape from within her. The woman lifts up the baby to show Y/n, it’s a boy, and Y/n immediately holds her hand out to hold her son. Y/n promises to her to son to protect him and not to allow anyone to harm him. After being cleaned up and her son cleaned, she and Jon are left alone once again. She names her son y/s/n snow, not wanting anyone to know the true identity of his father.

‘Thank you’ Y/n tells Jon quietly as they lay on clean furs, Y/n and Jon lie on their sides facing one another with y/s/n lying in the middle ‘For helping me get away from my father and staying by me’

‘I would never leave you, Y/n I have come to love you’

‘You love me?’

‘Aye, if you would have me. I won’t force myself upon you; I will look after you and y/s/n. I will take Y/s/n as if he were my own flesh and blood’

‘I love you too Jon and yes I will have you’

Jon moves closer to Y/n and presses his lips upon hers, for the first time Y/n does not feel herself recoiling and instead feeling happy. As Jon pulls away she smiles at him as he relaxes back into his spot, she feels happier than she had been her entire life. She was safe, she had her son that she loved more than life itself and now a man who returned her love.

[[MORE]]






Y/n hated it there; she longed to be free and away from the clutches of her leering father. Some nights she dreamt that she was someone else; instead of being unhappy of her existence Y/n was happy. Her father had preyed upon her since she was young, making Y/n and her sisters his bride, no one was allowed to touch them or look upon them. The hope she once held about escaping and leaving everything behind begun to diminish when she learned that she was with child. She did not wish to endanger her unborn child out there in the wilderness on her own; Y/n preyed that her father would not take her child away from her and sacrifices them to the white walkers.  

Y/n was seven moons when the Lord Commander and his rangers arrived to meet with her father; she had wandered outside to gather some water from the well. Her sisters had asked her to be careful, worried of the harm it may cause to her child, but her father did not care and ordered her outside anyway. She had been struggling with a heavy bucket of water when a young man came to her aid, at first she was weary she had never had been treated with kindness.

‘Let me help you with that’ he offered as saw her swollen stomach.

‘No I can manage’

‘It looks heavy; please I just want to help’

Y/n looked into his eyes attempting to see if he was lying but instead she saw only kindness, no coldness behind them. Jon takes the bucket from her hand as they slowly walk back towards her fathers keep.

‘Thank you’ she tells him ‘I am sorry if I was rude, my sisters and I are strangers to such kindnesses

‘I’m Jon’

‘Y/n’

‘Is your father always so…forward?’

‘My father is a monster’ she tells him with a scowl ‘I wish I could get away from here’

‘Did he do that to you?’

Y/n looks down at her stomach as she cradles herself with her hands.

‘Yes’

‘I am so sorry’

‘You do not need to apologise Jon, you did not do this and you do not know the horrors of what my father is capable of’ They stop a few feet from the entrance of the wooden building, Jon looks back at her concerned that something was wrong ‘I can take the bucket now, if my father catches you talking to me he will kill you’

‘I am not afraid of him’

‘Please, I do not want your death on my conscience’

Jon places the handle back into her hands and watches her walk back inside the dark hall; the wind begins to blow harder forcing him to wrap his cloak tighter around his neck.  He stays outside a little longer as his mind wanders back to Craster’s daughter Y/n; she was beautiful and could not believe that she had to suffer at the hands of her father. He was angered that the Lord Commander had done nothing to stop the man, if that had been his own sister Jon would have Craster killed. No longer able to take the cold wind Jon walks inside and finds Craster trying to grab at Y/n, but she escapes his clutches and rushes away. Jon takes a seat by the Lord Commander as he looks into the flames of the fire, attempting to ignore Craster and his cruel words.

That night the air had become colder as the fire began to dwindle, Jon shivers as he tries his hardest to stay warm. His back is pressed against the wall as he watches the others sleep on the floor, he was having trouble sleeping as he thought about his family. His mind is pulled away when he hears light footsteps approach him, as he scans the dim hall he can see Y/n walking towards him as she tries her hardest not to wake the others. In her arms she held a large wool blanket as she holds it out to him.

‘I saw that you were cold, I thought you could use a blanket’

‘Your father…’

‘You are safe, please take it, it is also to say thank you for helping me’

‘Thank you’ he tells her with a small smile.

‘Can I sit with you a while?’

Jon nods before she slowly sits down by his side, he sees her shiver as she settles down and wraps both her and himself in the blanket. He feels his body gradually warm up thanks to the thickness of the blanket.

‘Aren’t you worried that someone might see us?’ he asks as he looks at Y/n.

‘Not at this moment, I am so tired. My babe keeps me up at night and cannot sleep; it is nice to find someone to talk to other than my sisters. What made you join the Night watch?  Don’t you miss your family?’

‘My father was leaving for King’s Landing, with my sisters Arya and Sansa. I am a bastard, their mother Lady Stark does not like my presence at Winterfell and I would no longer be welcomed’

‘I never knew my mother; she died giving birth to me. Your mother does she live?’

‘I don’t know, my father never talked about her, he was ashamed for so long. Sometimes I think he regrets me’

‘I think your father loved you, he kept you at Winterfell for some time, I do not think he regrets your birth Jon. My father, he only see’s us as cattle and does not care that we are his own children. Where is your father?’ she asks curiously as she pulls the blanket tighter against her body.

‘He was killed by the Lannister’s’

‘Why would they do that?’

‘He told the truth and he died because of it, now my brother Robb marches for war against the Lannister’s. I don’t know if Arya and Sansa are still alive, my brother Bran and Rickon are alone at Winterfell’ he tells her as tears form in his eyes.

‘You should go to them, help them’

‘I can’t I made a vow’

‘I wish I could leave, I hate it here if I stay here I will die and so will my child’

‘How can you know that will happen?’

‘My father he does something with our children, he has sacrificed my brothers to the cold dark night. He takes them while we are sleeping and takes them into the woods, that is why there is no men here, no boys’ Y/n bows her head as she avoids his gaze.

‘What does he do to them?’

‘You wouldn’t believe me, no one does. They think we are all mad’

‘Please Y/n’

Y/n raises her head and looks into his eyes.

‘White walkers, he gives them to them so that he may live, he does not care for us’

‘White walkers are myth’

‘Tonight follow my father into the woods, my sister gave birth to a child he will take him and he will not be seen again’ telling him firmly, at the same time she feels her child kick within her ‘Ouch’

‘Are you okay?’

‘My child, they kicked. Do you want to feel it?’

He doesn’t answer her and only nods, Y/n takes his hand and places it onto her stomach, and he waits for a moment as he feels a small nudge against his palm he smiles as he looks down at his hand. Jon was surprised that the child continued to kick, he then looks up to Y/n and sees her smiling brightly. He was drawn into her beauty and her smile, after everything that was happening to her and around her she had a reason to smile.

‘I will help you’

Y/n looks up and meets his stare.

‘Help me?’

‘Get away from here, from your father I can keep you and your child safe’

‘Truly? It is not a trick’

‘Everything I have seen with the Night watch, it wasn’t what I expected. My family need me, I have to get back to my brother and help him with the Lannister’s’ he tells her ‘Gather your things, I will meet you outside and we will leave’

‘Thank you Jon, thank you’ Y/n leans into him and presses her lips against his cheek; she fails to see the red tint spreading onto his cheeks ‘I will get my things’

Y/n quickly stands and sneaks away as quiet as she can, whilst Jon walks outside into the cold night and to the stables. He quickly places the saddle onto the horse and the reins, hoping that he would not be seen and stopped. He is only waiting for a short time when Y/n finally joins him in the stables with a bag across her body.

‘Are you sure we should be doing this? I have heard what they do when men leave the Night’s Watch’

‘My brother needs me, if you’re right and stay here with your father you may die. If you come with me I promise to keep you safe, I give you my word’ he vows ‘I will not hurt you’

‘Okay, I will come but I think you will need to help me up onto your horse’

Jon chuckles as he takes her hand leading her to his stead, placing his hands onto her waist he lifts her up with a groan and places her onto the saddle.  Y/n shuffles forward so that Jon can sit behind her, as Jon climbs up Y/n feels his chest against her back. He moves his arms around her and takes the reins; he slowly leads the horse out of the camp hoping that they will not be heard and picks up the pace when he know they are safely away.

Along the way Y/n and Jon become lost in fog and mist, instead of leading them towards the wall they head further north. Jon becomes worried that he may come across wildlings in the hills, both of them scared that they may be caught by the Night’s Watch or her father. But her father had no army, he could lead a search for her and take her back home but the other rangers could. As time passed it was becoming harder for Y/n to move and travel upon the horse, Jon hoped to find somewhere safe for them to stay so she could give birth to her child.

They had camped for the night along the mountains, Jon had created a smile fire to keep them warm but it was so cold it wasn’t working.  Jon had wrapped them in a fur blanket that Y/n had brought with her; he hoped that their bodies close together would keep them warm. Y/n was the first to fall asleep, her head rested on his shoulder as he heard her lightly snore and Jon followed shortly after. Jon had to admire her, not once had she complained through their journey even when they realised they were lost and had no idea where they were going, but one thing he needed to do was get to his brother before it was too late.

They woke the next morning with figures standing above them and swords pointed at them, they were wildings, Jon quickly reaches for his sword but finds it missing.

‘Looking for this?’ a woman’s voice asks him, he looks up towards the voice and watches as they pull down their hood.

‘Another raven has lost his way, we should take him to Mance, and he will know what to do with him’ another voice interrupts.

‘Maybe we could kill him; he will lead more of the Night’s watch here’

Y/n shuffles her body into his side, scared of what they might do to them, worried that they may harm her baby.

‘I am no longer with the Night’s Watch’ Jon tells them firmly.

‘Ran off with a woman I see, I don’t understand those men and their stupid vows’ the woman speaks up ‘Take them with us, Mance will want to talk to this one’

Both Y/n and Jon are grabbed from behind and quickly pulled to their feet, the movement causing Y/n pain and clutch her stomach.

‘Ouch!’ Y/n calls out.

‘What’s wrong with her?’ the woman asks as she walks towards Y/n and pulls open her cloak. She smirks when she sees the woman’s swollen belly ‘Well someone has been busy’

Y/n and Jon have their hands tied and are taken on a long trek back the wildlings camp, Y/n remains by his side and do as the Wildlings asked scared of what they may do if she does not. It takes days before they reach the camp, both Jon and Y/n are surprised of the numbers of the free folk that are there and when they see a giant. They are pushed and shoved through the crowds of people that watch their arrival until they are pushed inside a large tent. It is there they are questioned by a man called Mance Raydar who was once a man of the Night’s Watch, many think the leader is made for allowing to live and believing that they may be spies.  But Mance listens to Jon telling them his reasons for leaving everything behind, Mance even offers the pair a tent believing that Y/n and Jon are together; even carrying Jon’s child.

During the night as Y/n lies on the ground upon the furs she goes into labour, Jon leaves her alone to find someone to help and finds an old woman who had assisted on many of the births of the free folk. As he walks into the tent he finds Y/n sitting up and her face contorted in pain, he quickly sits by her side as he tries to comfort her. The old woman moves between Y/n’s legs and lifts up her skirts, exposing her legs to the cold air.

‘Please don’t leave me Jon’

‘I’m not going anywhere’

Jon is true to his word and stays by her side; he does not leave the tent, not caring if he should be there or not. It is in the early hours of the following morning that her baby makes its way into the world, Jon holds firmly onto her hand as the old woman tells her to push. Y/n does as she says and begins to push; it is after the fifth push that she feels her baby escape from within her. The woman lifts up the baby to show Y/n, it’s a boy, and Y/n immediately holds her hand out to hold her son. Y/n promises to her to son to protect him and not to allow anyone to harm him. After being cleaned up and her son cleaned, she and Jon are left alone once again. She names her son y/s/n snow, not wanting anyone to know the true identity of his father.

‘Thank you’ Y/n tells Jon quietly as they lay on clean furs, Y/n and Jon lie on their sides facing one another with y/s/n lying in the middle ‘For helping me get away from my father and staying by me’

‘I would never leave you, Y/n I have come to love you’

‘You love me?’

‘Aye, if you would have me. I won’t force myself upon you; I will look after you and y/s/n. I will take Y/s/n as if he were my own flesh and blood’

‘I love you too Jon and yes I will have you’

Jon moves closer to Y/n and presses his lips upon hers, for the first time Y/n does not feel herself recoiling and instead feeling happy. As Jon pulls away she smiles at him as he relaxes back into his spot, she feels happier than she had been her entire life. She was safe, she had her son that she loved more than life itself and now a man who returned her love.

summary: character quotes: the jon storyline When he claimed the eagle that had been Orell's, he could feel the other skinchanger raging...
caption:
character quotes: the jon storyline

When he claimed the eagle that had been Orell’s, he could feel the other skinchanger raging at his presence. Orell had been slain by the turncloak crow Jon Snow, and his hate for his killer had been so strong that Varamyr found himself hating the beastling boy as well. He had known what Snow was the moment he saw that great white direwolf stalking silent at his side. One skinchanger can always sense another. Mance should have let me take the direwolf. There would be a second life worthy of a king. He could have done it, he did not doubt. The gift was strong in Snow, but the youth was untaught, still fighting his nature when he should have gloried in it. - VARAMYR

summary: Bittersweet - Chapter 19 - A letter from the vale
title: Bittersweet - Chapter 19 - A letter from the vale
body:
Another chapter of my slowburn…. Mostly setting up for the next greater arc. The vale might look like a diversion, but it is necessary for a latter plot point…. Also on AO3.

 “Dear Sansa, I hope this letter finds you and your children well. I have written several times already, but with the whole of Westeros in the grip of Winter, the ravens might not have reached you. The latest message I received from you was the news about the Riverlands. I was glad to hear that Hoster Tully has reached Winterfell. I am convinced that you will be an excellent warden for him. I suspect that you have written since, but no raven reached us here in the Vale.

My health has not been the best of late, although I try to keep quiet about it. The medicine I take is highly recommended by my new Maester Rhyswont, so I still have hope that my health improves. My old Maester Colemon has died of a sudden fever and my conditions has worsened since that. With the war in the South decided for Daenerys, my knights worry that we will have to face another threat from the South soon. Harold Hardyng, my beloved and trusted heir, is sceptical about your need for our knights. Even though several men have told him about the abominations they met north of the Wall, he refuses to believe. Therefore, I send him to Winterfell together with Maester Rhyswont, who is also a sceptic. I want him to judge the situation on his own. If anything happens to me I want my heir to honour our alliance. This is the fourth message I’ve sent to you and it might be, that by the time it reaches you, Harold is already close to Winterfell. Robin Arryn, Warden of the East.”

Jon read it out loud. When he had received the letter his first thought was that Sansa would help him steering through the troubled waters. Jon had the feeling that there was more to this letter than met the eye. Sansa knew her cousin. It was only when he had finished reading out the letter loudly and asked Sansa what it all meant that he realised that Sansa shook her head in an almost inperceptible way.

“We’d better discuss this in the council,” Sansa said at the same time as Gilly exclaimed loudly: “Maester Rhyswont!”

Jon was distracted by Gilly’s face which was a grimace of distaste.

“What about Maester Rhyswont?” he asked.

Gilly combed Podrick’s hair with determination which earned her a high-pitched yelp, when the comb did not run through his hair smoothly.

“Maester Rhyswont is a very good maester, but he treats women like they are all dumbwits. He was one of the few who would protest against me sitting quietly in the back of the classes to listen.” Gilly grumbled.

“He is a good healer though.”, she admitted. “He left shortly before we made our way North.”.

“If he is a good healer why does Lord Robin send him North though?”, Sansa mused, voicing one of the oddities of the letter. There was a frown on her forehead.

“And who sent the raven from the Vale, if he was already on his way here?” Jon asked.

“Robin might have someone at hand who is capable to tend the ravens.” Sansa stretched out her hand and Jon handed her the letter.

“This letter is from Robin,” she confirmed, fingering Robin’s signature.

“What do you make of it?” Jon wanted to know.

Sansa sighed. “We really should discuss this in council,” she chided him, but relented when she saw his face. His anxiousness which had nothing to do with Maester Rhyswont or Lord Robin’s health must have been visible on his face.

“It is odd, that Robin mentions the new medicine. I would say, that he suspects that it is not good for his health at all and he wants the Maester away to test this.” Sansa looked at the nitcomb absentmindedly.

“I do not like this,” she admitted. “He calls this Harold his ‘beleoved and trusted’ heir. Why trust him, if he is sceptic about the White Walkers and the conditions of our alliance.”

The alliance. The alliance he wants honoured. Jon felt a cold fear clutch at his heart. He knew how alliances were forged and he did not like it. Not at all. Harold comes as a suitor for Sansa’s hand. He looked down at his hand that shook with anger at the thought and tried to get his temper in hand. Sansa will not leave Winterfell, she’ll stay here with me. He wished he could feel secure about this. What will she do, if this Harold sets conditions for the troops from the Vale. What if Robin dies? Jon had never met Sansa’s cousin and Sansa had told him that the sickly Robin was not easy to deal with, but he was fond of his cousin and Jon knew that it was only due to this fondness that Robin had refrained from revenging Littlefinger’s death. He had been a good ally over three years, and the Vale had bled in the continuous war against the Walkers like the North had.

Sansa seemed to feel Jon’s eyes on her and tried a reassuring smile.

“I do think he wants us to assess this Maester Rhyswont and his heir. It is a prudent move. Let the sceptic learn something about our war, remove the Maester in case he is behind his worsened health, and remove his heir who might be overly ambitions. If I read this letter right, Robin had to appease a hostile fraction at his court.” She paused.

“It also means he trust us to convince that fraction and help him.” She looked at the comb in her hands again and then raised her face to him. Her blue eyes met his.

“Apparently he did learn some things while he was Littlefinger’s ward”, Jon tried to distract some of the tension with a joke.

The corner of Sansa’s mouth only quirked lightly.

“So many ravens lost worries me,” Sansa said. “I’ve written twice while you were at the wall. It could be an accident of course.”

She concentrated on her comb again. She’s avoiding looking at me. Jon’s heart felt like a lump in his chest. He had hoped that he was mistaken about the message of the last sentence.

There was an uncomfortable silence. Jon could feel the blood rushing in his ears. I should not have come, I should have waited.

“We should decide on what our answer will be, if that Harold wants to marry me.” Sansa said in an almost whisper. She looked up again and this time she held Jon’s gaze.

His heart made an odd jump. Our answer. He felt as if Sansa and he were the only people in the room. He did not see any of the others in the room, just Sansa.

“We cannot outright deny him,” Jon answered. “Not before he has pledged to fight with us against the Walkers.” I could always just chop off his head. That dark thought came unbidden and Jon shuddered involuntarily.

“No, but we can detain him. It might mean that you’ll have to go to the Wall again to show him proof.”

Jon felt blood rush in his face. It filled him with grim satisfaction that there was no question for Sansa, that she would not want to marry this Harold, but he also realised that he might have given away some of his feelings to others. Again. I must be more careful.

“I would like to avoid that. With the gods staying silent, I feel there is great danger here in Winterfell. ‘Stay alert’ they said. No order about going North.” ‘Stay alert. Stay steadfast’. Jon did not want to leave again.

“Yes, that is worrying. I really wish they had been clearer about that.” Sansa agreed.

Suddenly she laughed.

“The best way to detain him would probably be to avoid that he even asks the question,” she finally said, when she had contained her mirth.

“You just have to pretend that you don’t understand his question at all. Keep yourself busy, keep bannermen around you. And I’ll be very carefuly that he doesn’t catch me alone either.”

Her eyes glinted with amusement.

“Maybe it was a good idea, that you brought this here. I’m sure we can spread the word, that people have to keep us busy.”

Jon smiled. The scheme did appeal to him, but it would mean less time alone with Sansa. Not that they had had much of this lately. I guess, if I want some time alone, I have to catch nits again.

“I still would like to have an edge. I don’t trust this Harold already. If you read Robin’s letter right, he might be very dangerous in his ambition.”

Jon let his eyes wander around the room, fully taking in the persons in the room for the first time.

His gaze went back to Lady Alys. He narrowed his eyes. The Gods told me that she is like my sister. I should trust her.

“Lady Alys, there is a great opportunity to prove your loyalty” he addressed her.

Alys looked up, her face curious in a way that did remind him of his sister Arya and shortly made his heart ache.

“You know how to fight, but you have not yet a reputation like Lady Brienne has.” Alys made a face as if she had an idea what Jon was about to ask.

“Have you written to Robin about Alys?” Jon asked Sansa. She shook her head.

“You could be the new court lady of Lady Sansa, dagger hidden in your dress, just in case. It would comfort me to know that somebody is around Lady Sansa, in case this Harold forgets himself.”

Alys’ face fell. “A dress?”, she exclaimed, misery plain on her face.

Jon grinned. “A dress. You would only need to do this for as long as this Harold Hardyng is here.” He couldn’t help himself. His voice already betrayed his dislike for a man he had never met.

“Jon,” Sansa interrupted him. “You cannot possibly order Lady Alys to do that. It’s clear she doesn’t like dresses.”

Alys turned her face to Sansa.

“I’ll do it,” she said. “I’ll wear bloody dresses and prevent that man to get you alone.”

That took Sansa by surprise, Jon could see that.

“Only under one condition, though,” Alys added.

“Which would be?”, Sansa asked.

Alys gave her a mischievous grin that made her look like a younger girl.

“If these men from the Vale bring nits and lice to Winterfell again I want you to allow me to dump them from the castle battlements and drive them out of Winterfell.”

“I’ll do the dumping with you.”

Gilly combed Podrick’s hair with determination which earned her a high-pitched yelp, when the comb did not run through his hair smoothly.

“Maester Rhyswont is a very good maester, but he treats women like they are all dumbwits. He was one of the few who would protest against me sitting quietly in the back of the classes to listen.” Gilly grumbled.

“He is a good healer though.”, she admitted. “He left shortly before we made our way North.”.

“If he is a good healer why does Lord Robin send him North though?”, Sansa mused, voicing one of the oddities of the letter. There was a frown on her forehead.

“And who sent the raven from the Vale, if he was already on his way here?” Jon asked.

“Robin might have someone at hand who is capable to tend the ravens.” Sansa stretched out her hand and Jon handed her the letter.

“This letter is from Robin,” she confirmed, fingering Robin’s signature.

“What do you make of it?” Jon wanted to know.

Sansa sighed. “We really should discuss this in council,” she chided him, but relented when she saw his face. His anxiousness which had nothing to do with Maester Rhyswont or Lord Robin’s health must have been visible on his face.

“It is odd, that Robin mentions the new medicine. I would say, that he suspects that it is not good for his health at all and he wants the Maester away to test this.” Sansa looked at the nitcomb absentmindedly.

“I do not like this,” she admitted. “He calls this Harold his ‘beleoved and trusted’ heir. Why trust him, if he is sceptic about the White Walkers and the conditions of our alliance.”

The alliance. The alliance he wants honoured. Jon felt a cold fear clutch at his heart. He knew how alliances were forged and he did not like it. Not at all. Harold comes as a suitor for Sansa’s hand. He looked down at his hand that shook with anger at the thought and tried to get his temper in hand. Sansa will not leave Winterfell, she’ll stay here with me. He wished he could feel secure about this. What will she do, if this Harold sets conditions for the troops from the Vale. What if Robin dies? Jon had never met Sansa’s cousin and Sansa had told him that the sickly Robin was not easy to deal with, but he was fond of his cousin and Jon knew that it was only due to this fondness that Robin had refrained from revenging Littlefinger’s death. He had been a good ally over three years, and the Vale had bled in the continuous war against the Walkers like the North had.

Sansa seemed to feel Jon’s eyes on her and tried a reassuring smile.

“I do think he wants us to assess this Maester Rhyswont and his heir. It is a prudent move. Let the sceptic learn something about our war, remove the Maester in case he is behind his worsened health, and remove his heir who might be overly ambitions. If I read this letter right, Robin had to appease a hostile fraction at his court.” She paused.

“It also means he trust us to convince that fraction and help him.” She looked at the comb in her hands again and then raised her face to him. Her blue eyes met his.

“Apparently he did learn some things while he was Littlefinger’s ward”, Jon tried to distract some of the tension with a joke.

The corner of Sansa’s mouth only quirked lightly.

“So many ravens lost worries me,” Sansa said. “I’ve written twice while you were at the wall. It could be an accident of course.”

She concentrated on her comb again. She’s avoiding looking at me. Jon’s heart felt like a lump in his chest. He had hoped that he was mistaken about the message of the last sentence.

There was an uncomfortable silence. Jon could feel the blood rushing in his ears. I should not have come, I should have waited.

“We should decide on what our answer will be, if that Harold wants to marry me.” Sansa said in an almost whisper. She looked up again and this time she held Jon’s gaze.

His heart made an odd jump. Our answer. He felt as if Sansa and he were the only people in the room. He did not see any of the others in the room, just Sansa.

“We cannot outright deny him,” Jon answered. “Not before he has pledged to fight with us against the Walkers.” I could always just chop off his head. That dark thought came unbidden and Jon shuddered involuntarily.

“No, but we can detain him. It might mean that you’ll have to go to the Wall again to show him proof.”

Jon felt blood rush in his face. It filled him with grim satisfaction that there was no question for Sansa, that she would not want to marry this Harold, but he also realised that he might have given away some of his feelings to others. Again. I must be more careful.

“I would like to avoid that. With the gods staying silent, I feel there is great danger here in Winterfell. ‘Stay alert’ they said. No order about going North.” ‘Stay alert. Stay steadfast’. Jon did not want to leave again.

“Yes, that is worrying. I really wish they had been clearer about that.” Sansa agreed.

Suddenly she laughed.

“The best way to detain him would probably be to avoid that he even asks the question,” she finally said, when she had contained her mirth.

“You just have to pretend that you don’t understand his question at all. Keep yourself busy, keep bannermen around you. And I’ll be very carefuly that he doesn’t catch me alone either.”

Her eyes glinted with amusement.

“Maybe it was a good idea, that you brought this here. I’m sure we can spread the word, that people have to keep us busy.”

Jon smiled. The scheme did appeal to him, but it would mean less time alone with Sansa. Not that they had had much of this lately. I guess, if I want some time alone, I have to catch nits again.

“I still would like to have an edge. I don’t trust this Harold already. If you read Robin’s letter right, he might be very dangerous in his ambition.”

Jon let his eyes wander around the room, fully taking in the persons in the room for the first time.

His gaze went back to Lady Alys. He narrowed his eyes. The Gods told me that she is like my sister. I should trust her.

“Lady Alys, there is a great opportunity to prove your loyalty” he addressed her.

Alys looked up, her face curious in a way that did remind him of his sister Arya and shortly made his heart ache.

“You know how to fight, but you have not yet a reputation like Lady Brienne has.” Alys made a face as if she had an idea what Jon was about to ask.

“Have you written to Robin about Alys?” Jon asked Sansa. She shook her head.

“You could be the new court lady of Lady Sansa, dagger hidden in your dress, just in case. It would comfort me to know that somebody is around Lady Sansa, in case this Harold forgets himself.”

Alys’ face fell. “A dress?”, she exclaimed, misery plain on her face.

Jon grinned. “A dress. You would only need to do this for as long as this Harold Hardyng is here.” He couldn’t help himself. His voice already betrayed his dislike for a man he had never met.

“Jon,” Sansa interrupted him. “You cannot possibly order Lady Alys to do that. It’s clear she doesn’t like dresses.”

Alys turned her face to Sansa.

“I’ll do it,” she said. “I’ll wear bloody dresses and prevent that man to get you alone.”

That took Sansa by surprise, Jon could see that.

“Only under one condition, though,” Alys added.

“Which would be?”, Sansa asked.

Alys gave her a mischievous grin that made her look like a younger girl.

“If these men from the Vale bring nits and lice to Winterfell again I want you to allow me to dump them from the castle battlements and drive them out of Winterfell.”

“I’ll do the dumping with you.”

My health has not been the best of late, although I try to keep quiet about it. The medicine I take is highly recommended by my new Maester Rhyswont, so I still have hope that my health improves. My old Maester Colemon has died of a sudden fever and my conditions has worsened since that. Harold Hardyng, my beloved and trusted heir, is sceptical about your need for our knights. summary: Bran: Your average pineapple, peeled and cut makes about 4.5 cups or 36 ounces of pineapple chunks. Cans of pineapple come in a...
body:
Bran: Your average pineapple, peeled and cut makes about 4.5 cups or 36 ounces of pineapple chunks. Cans of pineapple come in a variety of sizes the most common being 20oz and 46oz. Meaning a single pineapple generally won’t fill up a single can perfectly, which also means every time you eat pineapple from a can somewhere someone else has the can that has the rest of that same pineapple. Meaning you can share a single fruit with a stranger from hundreds of miles away and i think that’s beautiful.

Jon: How much sleep are you getting?

Bran: Not enough.

summary: prompt theon finally works up the nerve to confess to robb but robb is very confused because he was under the impression they...
question: prompt theon finally works up the nerve to confess to robb but robb is very confused because he was under the impression they had been dating for the past year
answer:
this is really badly written and I’m sorry. according to ao3 i havent posted a fic since december 2017 so sorry this is crapppppy.

The Argument (Throbb + Jon)

“Your brother is an idiot.”

Jon remained somewhat speechless as he watched Theon slam his front door shut and commandeer his couch, laying back on it with his arms crossed tightly over his chest. Jon looked around to see if Robb had magically appeared as well considering Theon never came to Jon’s apartment alone. Jon wasn’t even aware Theon had a key.

“Uh why-”

“I mean, he can’t just assume things! That’s not how the world works. What’s that stupid saying Bran always says?  ‘Assumptions make an ass out of you and me?’ Well, it’s right. I feel like an ass and Robb is an even bigger ass.”

Jon snapped his mouth shut and rewound the last few seconds in his head to see if he had missed something as to why Theon was pouting on his couch.

“Did you and Robb get in a fight?” he asked.

He set down the book he was reading and awkwardly tried to put on a face of sympathy. In the instances of Robb and Theon’s fights, Robb was usually the one to lay on Jon’s couch and vent. It was rare for Theon to ever come to Jon, especially for emotional venting.  

“No shit,” Theon muttered. “Maybe dumbassary runs through your family.”

Jon raised an eyebrow, any form of sympathy melting away with irritation. “Maybe you should leave.” Jon stood up, ready to throw Theon out the door.

“Fuck, no, wait.” Theon screwed his face together in pain as he said, “I’m sorry. I didn’t mean it.”

Now Jon was completely confused. It was already unusual for Theon and him to be alone and talking…it was unheard of for Theon to apologize. The only person Theon even showed common human decency to was Robb.

“It was a big fight then, yeah?” Jon reclaimed his seat in the armchair.

Theon didn’t answer the question, just stewing in his anger and glaring up at the ceiling. Jon wasn’t exactly sure how to tackle the subject and just sat in silence, waiting for Theon to speak.

“He thinks we are dating.”

“Oh…”

Theon sat up rapidly and shot Jon a look of betrayal. “Not you too?!”

“I think we all thought you were dating,” Jon admitted. “You’re not?”

“No!” Theon yelled, grabbing the pillow off Jon’s couch and holding it to his face to scream.

“Is this a homophobic thing?” Jon asked gently. “Because if it is-”

“Robb and I have fucked. That’s not the problem.”

Jon grimaced. “I didn’t need to know that.” Theon didn’t look the least bit sorry, but rather a bit smug. At least he wasn’t screaming though that look was equally annoying. “So, you’re not dating?”

“No,” Theon hissed, throwing the pillow aside. “I was going to ask him yesterday. Make that shit official.”

“Oh.” Jon wasn’t sure he was seeing a problem here. “And-”

“I made reservations that the sushi place! The expensive one by the riverside. And I was going to make the whole thing romantic and classy. I put a lot of thought into this shit and he had the audacity to say he thought we were already dating. Without my consent.” Theon laid back on the couch once again, mimicking a dramatic renaissance painting with his hand thrown over his eyes and his chicken legs draped over the couch arm

“I feel like I’m missing something. Did you not want to date Robb?” Jon asked, rubbing his temples. He could feel himself getting a headache.

“Fuck yeah, I wanted to date him. Since high school.” Jon felt like that was a revelation that shouldn’t just be glossed over but Theon continued on anyway, “But he just assumed we were. Just because we live together and make out and go on vacations together and sleep in the same bed.”

“Yeah, Robb is completely in the wrong there,” Jon said, each word evenly coated in sarcasm as he rolled his eyes. “How wrong of him to assume?”

Theon narrowed his eyes. “You can’t just assume you are dating someone because you do that shit with them.”

“So you are upset you weren’t notified sooner?”

“No, dickhead, I’m pissed because I wasn’t ever asked. He took the decision right out from under me.”

Jon quirked up his eyebrow. “He never forced you to kiss him and live with him.”

Theon deflated a bit, only a bit. “Well, no, he never forced anything. But like, dating is serious shit.”

“You’ve dated half of Winterfell.”

“Oh my god, Snow, Jon, idiot boy, that wasn’t dating.” Theon dragged his hand down his face in exhausted. “That was messing around.”

“So all this time you thought you were messing around with Robb?” Now Jon was beginning to feel a bit angry. “Please tell me you weren’t seeing other people too.”

Theon flinched at the accusation. “No. It’s not that. But I would have been like, nicer or some shit. If I knew we were dating, I would have done more boyfriend shit. Maybe let Robb meet my sister.”

“I thought Robb already met your sister.”

“I meant as my boyfriend, not my best friend since grade school.” Theon paused as a realization hit him. “Oh fuck, does your whole family know?”

“We’ve known since high school and you two weren’t even dating them.”

“Hey! We still aren’t dating.”

“You broke up then?”

“We were never together! Just because he says we were dating, doesn’t mean I say it. That’s not how that shit works. I mean, are we just declaring shit? Just saying words. Like I can say I’ve been dating your mom for six years because I basically lived in your guys’ house.”

“Theon, the fuck-“

“Oh, I’m sorry; I thought we were just saying shit.” He fell back against Jon’s couch, hugging the pillow to his chest. “You know what the worst part is?”

“Oh gods, there is a worst part to all this nonsense?”

Theon glared at him, but continued on, “Robb doesn’t even think it is a big deal. Not until I got upset.”

“I think I’ll have to take his side on that one,” Jon said.

“Why you always have to take his side? Just because you guys are related?”

Jon stared at Theon. “Really? Not because you are a dick all the time?”                

“Whatever. Maybe it isn’t a big deal to you guys, but it is to me.”

Before Jon could even untangle that line of thinking, a soft knock came from his door. Jon stood to get it but Theon grabbed Jon’s arm, yanking him back.

“I think that’s Robb,” Theon hissed quietly. “Pretend you aren’t home.”

“He can probably see my car in the parking lot, idiot.” Jon wrestled his arm from Theon’s grasp.

“But I don’t want to see him,” Theon hissed.

“Well, that’s not my problem then, is it?” Jon snapped back. “You should’ve gone somewhere else to be a dramatic idiot.”

“Bro, I thought we were friends.”

Jon didn’t even bother tackling that one and instead opened the door to see Robb there, hands deep in his pockets and his eyes downturned. Jon didn’t even speak; he just opened the door wider to Robb to step through.

Jon watched as Robb and Theon’s eyes met. Sadness and anger clashing in uncomfortable silence. Robb had yet to say a word, just staring at Theon hopelessly.

“I’ll make coffee,” Jon muttered, trying to leave to room.

“No need,” Theon said, standing up. “I’m leaving.” He threw Jon a hateful look. “I can’t believe you are picking him over me.”

“Who would have ever guessed that?” Jon muttered.

It went unanswered as Theon tried to walk past Robb but was stopped. The two stared at each other, communicating telepathically or some shit. Jon didn’t know. He used to always get frustrated that the two of them could be having a completely silent conversation while Jon sat there lost.

Jon tried to understand what was being said, or really what wasn’t as the two stared. Robb’s hand was tight on Theon’s wrist, tugging or maybe pleading. They stared unblinkingly at each other. Jon thought, for a moment, he could see Theon’s face soften and Robb’s eyes brighten.

“Fine,” Theon muttered gently to Robb before turning to Jon. “Dickhead, we’re using your room to talk.”

Jon just stood and watched as Theon and Robb disappeared down the hall, the door to his room shutting softly behind them.  Jon felt like the past twenty minutes had been six hours. He was exhausted, confused and quite frankly just done with this nonsense.

Minutes ticked by in silence. Jon could just barely hear the faint murmur of them speaking as he went about making coffee, something to set his head back on straight and dull his headache. Once that was finished, he sat back in his chair and tried to read his book again, but ever couple of sentences his eyes would drift up towards the wall clock and down the hall.

Nearly half an hour and three cups of coffee later, the door to his room creaked open. Jon tried not to look eager as he watched the two walk side by side down, the hall. Their hands were intertwined and both seemed to be walking on air. Jon let out a breath of relief.

“All good then?” Jon asked hesitantly. He could never tell with these two.

“Yup!” Robb grinned brightly.

“All sorted,” Theon nodded with a faint smirk. “Also, you owe us a gift.”

Jon blinked. “Why?”

“It’d be rude not to get the happy couple a gift on their anniversary,” Theon explained. “And you’re three months late.”

“I thought you weren’t dating until yesterday!” Jon threw his hands up in the air.

“We decided we’ve been dating for about fifteen months,” Robb said sheepishly. He went on to explain, “We traced back our history and decided it would be silly to say we started dating yesterday when in actuality we’ve been acting like a couple for much longer than that…it’s a bit complicated but we’ve sorted it.”

“And we picked an anniversary. June 8th.”

“Why June 8th?” Jon asked, though he knew the answer would make just as much sense as this whole afternoon has been.

“I don’t know,” Robb shrugged. “It sounds like a nice date.”

“It’s also World Oceans Day according to the calendar on your desk. Don’t worry, I’ve already taken the liberty to write our anniversary in it so you won’t forget.”

Jon could only bury his head in his hands in dismay. “Just get out.”

“Thanks Jon!” Robb waved, sending an apologetic smile.

“Later, dickhead.”

“Uh why-”

“I mean, he can’t just assume things! That’s not how the world works. What’s that stupid saying Bran always says?  ‘Assumptions make an ass out of you and me?’ Well, it’s right. I feel like an ass and Robb is an even bigger ass.”

Jon snapped his mouth shut and rewound the last few seconds in his head to see if he had missed something as to why Theon was pouting on his couch.

“Did you and Robb get in a fight?” he asked.

He set down the book he was reading and awkwardly tried to put on a face of sympathy. In the instances of Robb and Theon’s fights, Robb was usually the one to lay on Jon’s couch and vent. It was rare for Theon to ever come to Jon, especially for emotional venting.  

“No shit,” Theon muttered. “Maybe dumbassary runs through your family.”

Jon raised an eyebrow, any form of sympathy melting away with irritation. “Maybe you should leave.” Jon stood up, ready to throw Theon out the door.

“Fuck, no, wait.” Theon screwed his face together in pain as he said, “I’m sorry. I didn’t mean it.”

Now Jon was completely confused. It was already unusual for Theon and him to be alone and talking…it was unheard of for Theon to apologize. The only person Theon even showed common human decency to was Robb.

“It was a big fight then, yeah?” Jon reclaimed his seat in the armchair.

Theon didn’t answer the question, just stewing in his anger and glaring up at the ceiling. Jon wasn’t exactly sure how to tackle the subject and just sat in silence, waiting for Theon to speak.

“He thinks we are dating.”

“Oh…”

Theon sat up rapidly and shot Jon a look of betrayal. “Not you too?!”

“I think we all thought you were dating,” Jon admitted. “You’re not?”

“No!” Theon yelled, grabbing the pillow off Jon’s couch and holding it to his face to scream.

“Is this a homophobic thing?” Jon asked gently. “Because if it is-”

“Robb and I have fucked. That’s not the problem.”

Jon grimaced. “I didn’t need to know that.” Theon didn’t look the least bit sorry, but rather a bit smug. At least he wasn’t screaming though that look was equally annoying. “So, you’re not dating?”

“No,” Theon hissed, throwing the pillow aside. “I was going to ask him yesterday. Make that shit official.”

“Oh.” Jon wasn’t sure he was seeing a problem here. “And-”

“I made reservations that the sushi place! The expensive one by the riverside. And I was going to make the whole thing romantic and classy. I put a lot of thought into this shit and he had the audacity to say he thought we were already dating. Without my consent.” Theon laid back on the couch once again, mimicking a dramatic renaissance painting with his hand thrown over his eyes and his chicken legs draped over the couch arm

“I feel like I’m missing something. Did you not want to date Robb?” Jon asked, rubbing his temples. He could feel himself getting a headache.

“Fuck yeah, I wanted to date him. Since high school.” Jon felt like that was a revelation that shouldn’t just be glossed over but Theon continued on anyway, “But he just assumed we were. Just because we live together and make out and go on vacations together and sleep in the same bed.”

“Yeah, Robb is completely in the wrong there,” Jon said, each word evenly coated in sarcasm as he rolled his eyes. “How wrong of him to assume?”

Theon narrowed his eyes. “You can’t just assume you are dating someone because you do that shit with them.”

“So you are upset you weren’t notified sooner?”

“No, dickhead, I’m pissed because I wasn’t ever asked. He took the decision right out from under me.”

Jon quirked up his eyebrow. “He never forced you to kiss him and live with him.”

Theon deflated a bit, only a bit. “Well, no, he never forced anything. But like, dating is serious shit.”

“You’ve dated half of Winterfell.”

“Oh my god, Snow, Jon, idiot boy, that wasn’t dating.” Theon dragged his hand down his face in exhausted. “That was messing around.”

“So all this time you thought you were messing around with Robb?” Now Jon was beginning to feel a bit angry. “Please tell me you weren’t seeing other people too.”

Theon flinched at the accusation. “No. It’s not that. But I would have been like, nicer or some shit. If I knew we were dating, I would have done more boyfriend shit. Maybe let Robb meet my sister.”

“I thought Robb already met your sister.”

“I meant as my boyfriend, not my best friend since grade school.” Theon paused as a realization hit him. “Oh fuck, does your whole family know?”

“We’ve known since high school and you two weren’t even dating them.”

“Hey! We still aren’t dating.”

“You broke up then?”

“We were never together! Just because he says we were dating, doesn’t mean I say it. That’s not how that shit works. I mean, are we just declaring shit? Just saying words. Like I can say I’ve been dating your mom for six years because I basically lived in your guys’ house.”

“Theon, the fuck-“

“Oh, I’m sorry; I thought we were just saying shit.” He fell back against Jon’s couch, hugging the pillow to his chest. “You know what the worst part is?”

“Oh gods, there is a worst part to all this nonsense?”

“I think I’ll have to take his side on that one,” Jon said.

“Why you always have to take his side? Just because you guys are related?”

Jon stared at Theon. “Really? Not because you are a dick all the time?”                

“Whatever. Maybe it isn’t a big deal to you guys, but it is to me.”

Before Jon could even untangle that line of thinking, a soft knock came from his door. Jon stood to get it but Theon grabbed Jon’s arm, yanking him back.

“I think that’s Robb,” Theon hissed quietly. “Pretend you aren’t home.”

“He can probably see my car in the parking lot, idiot.” Jon wrestled his arm from Theon’s grasp.

“But I don’t want to see him,” Theon hissed.

“Well, that’s not my problem then, is it?” Jon snapped back. “You should’ve gone somewhere else to be a dramatic idiot.”

“Bro, I thought we were friends.”

Jon didn’t even bother tackling that one and instead opened the door to see Robb there, hands deep in his pockets and his eyes downturned. Jon didn’t even speak; he just opened the door wider to Robb to step through.

Jon watched as Robb and Theon’s eyes met. Sadness and anger clashing in uncomfortable silence. Robb had yet to say a word, just staring at Theon hopelessly.

“I’ll make coffee,” Jon muttered, trying to leave to room.

“No need,” Theon said, standing up. “I’m leaving.” He threw Jon a hateful look. “I can’t believe you are picking him over me.”

“Who would have ever guessed that?” Jon muttered.

It went unanswered as Theon tried to walk past Robb but was stopped. The two stared at each other, communicating telepathically or some shit. Jon didn’t know. He used to always get frustrated that the two of them could be having a completely silent conversation while Jon sat there lost.

Jon tried to understand what was being said, or really what wasn’t as the two stared. Robb’s hand was tight on Theon’s wrist, tugging or maybe pleading. They stared unblinkingly at each other. Jon thought, for a moment, he could see Theon’s face soften and Robb’s eyes brighten.

“Fine,” Theon muttered gently to Robb before turning to Jon. “Dickhead, we’re using your room to talk.”

Jon just stood and watched as Theon and Robb disappeared down the hall, the door to his room shutting softly behind them.  Jon felt like the past twenty minutes had been six hours. He was exhausted, confused and quite frankly just done with this nonsense.

Minutes ticked by in silence. Jon could just barely hear the faint murmur of them speaking as he went about making coffee, something to set his head back on straight and dull his headache. Once that was finished, he sat back in his chair and tried to read his book again, but ever couple of sentences his eyes would drift up towards the wall clock and down the hall.

Nearly half an hour and three cups of coffee later, the door to his room creaked open. Jon tried not to look eager as he watched the two walk side by side down, the hall. Their hands were intertwined and both seemed to be walking on air. Jon let out a breath of relief.

“All good then?” Jon asked hesitantly. He could never tell with these two.

“Yup!” Robb grinned brightly.

“All sorted,” Theon nodded with a faint smirk. “Also, you owe us a gift.”

Jon blinked. “Why?”

“It’d be rude not to get the happy couple a gift on their anniversary,” Theon explained. “And you’re three months late.”

“I thought you weren’t dating until yesterday!” Jon threw his hands up in the air.

“We decided we’ve been dating for about fifteen months,” Robb said sheepishly. He went on to explain, “We traced back our history and decided it would be silly to say we started dating yesterday when in actuality we’ve been acting like a couple for much longer than that…it’s a bit complicated but we’ve sorted it.”

“And we picked an anniversary. June 8th.”

“Why June 8th?” Jon asked, though he knew the answer would make just as much sense as this whole afternoon has been.

“I don’t know,” Robb shrugged. “It sounds like a nice date.”

“It’s also World Oceans Day according to the calendar on your desk. Don’t worry, I’ve already taken the liberty to write our anniversary in it so you won’t forget.”

Jon could only bury his head in his hands in dismay. “Just get out.”

“Thanks Jon!” Robb waved, sending an apologetic smile.

“Later, dickhead.”

“Your brother is an idiot.”

Jon remained somewhat speechless as he watched Theon slam his front door shut and commandeer his couch, laying back on it with his arms crossed tightly over his chest. Jon looked around to see if Robb had magically appeared as well considering Theon never came to Jon’s apartment alone. Jon wasn’t even aware Theon had a key.

summary: I'm rereading Dany's visions in the HoTU and now I'm thinking she might kill Jon at some point. the voice says "daughter of...
question: I'm rereading Dany's visions in the HoTU and now I'm thinking she might kill Jon at some point. the voice says "daughter of death" right after she sees her brothers and son (deaths that served to make her the targ heir/mother of dragons) then "slayer of lies" after stannis and probably young griff aka pretenders she'll probably expose or kill. finally it says "bride of fire" right after showing her wedding night to Drogo (who she was a bride to and who she set on fire on that pyre)along with 1/2
answer:
the “smiling corpse” and the “blue flower”. following that logic, whoever these 2 are, I think they’re men she’ll marry (or ally with) but will end up burning like Drogo (either on a pyre or with dragonfire). there seems to be an agreement that Jon is the blue flower and, I’m not big on Jon/Dany theories, but if she does fall in love with him and she must light a fire “for love”, could that also be about Jon? I’m sure I’m just over thinking this, but I can’t unsee it now. what do you think? 2/2

I am real sorry if Jon/Dany’s not your cup of tea, but I honestly think that Dany’s House of the Undying vision about the blue flower is a straight up indication of Jon/Dany. I know people have argued that the use of “sweetness” here foreshadows death and rot, but I find that argument unconvincing; the visual is of a flower growing in defiance of the cold. To me, you don’t get much more straightforward foreshadowing of love to come.

It’s also possible that all three of her marriages end in fire. Can’t rule that out. What does not follow is that all three marriages end in murder or other grim circumstances. If the fire for love involves Jon, it’s either a) a fire they light together or b) a fire she lights for his sake. If she does kill him, it’s going to be a mutually agreed and fully consensual sacrifice (unlikely, to my mind - GRRM looks to be pretty clear on self-sacrifice being the only way to do this sort of thing) - something they do selflessly, for the good of the world.

Alternatively, it could be a fire Dany sets alone at the end of the series to destroy the White Walkers, done for love of life. Even should Dany fall in love with Jon, there’s going to be more love in her life than just him.
